sentence.Network_en: He stopped and watched with amusement to see the child so absorbed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他停下来，饶有兴趣地看着孩子如此投入。

sentence.Network_en: Steamers tooted at us as sailors on deck waved in amusement.
sentence.Network_cn: 汽船向我们嘟嘟鸣笛时，甲板上的水手们饶有趣味地挥着手。

sentence.Network_en: He looked at me, a flicker of amusement in his cold eyes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看着我，冷酷的眼神里闪过一丝嘲笑。

原因非常简单:为了逃避娱乐税(Amusement Tax)的缴纳。这一税收始于魏玛共和国时期。当时,如果在放映一部未经电影审查委员会定级的故事片之前加映一部已经评级的.
从零开始学语法：一起来学反身代词_英语网 ... for oneself 替自己 amuse oneself 自娱自乐 help oneself to 随便吃.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'musing, diversion of the attention'): from French, from the verb amuser (see amuse)

encyclopedia.content: 翻译amusement [美国] [əˈmjuzmənt] [英国] [əˈmjuːzmənt] 名词乐趣；兴味[不可数名词] To our amusement, the actor jumped on and off the stage. 令我们感到有趣的是，那个演员从舞台跳上跳下。 娱乐，消遣；娱乐活动[可数名词][不可数名词] Reading and seeing movies are among my amusements. 阅读和看电影也是我的消遣方式。 They often sing for their ow

entry.def: Amusement is the feeling that you have when you think that something is funny or amusing.

example.ex: He stopped and watched with amusement to see the child so absorbed...
example.tran: 他停下来，饶有兴趣地看着孩子如此投入。

example.ex: Steamers tooted at us as sailors on deck waved in amusement.
example.tran: 汽船向我们嘟嘟鸣笛时，甲板上的水手们饶有趣味地挥着手。

entry.def: Amusement is the pleasure that you get from being entertained or from doing something interesting.

example.ex: I stumbled sideways before landing flat on my back, much to the amusement of the rest of the lads...
example.tran: 让其他小伙子们笑不可支的是，我被绊了一跤，身子一歪，结果仰面摔倒在地。

example.ex: She excelled at impersonations, which provided great amusement for him and his friends.
example.tran: 她擅长模仿，给他和他的朋友们带来了很多欢乐。

entry.def: Amusements are ways of passing the time pleasantly.

example.ex: People had very few amusements to choose from. There was no radio, or television.
example.tran: 人们几乎没有什么消遣可以选择。没有广播，也没有电视。

entry.tran: （游乐场或海边的）娱乐活动，游戏，消遣活动
entry.def: Amusements are games, rides, and other things that you can enjoy, for example at a fairground or at the seaside.

example.ex: ...a place full of swings and amusements.
example.tran: 装有秋千并设有许多娱乐活动的地方

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of delight at being entertained
2. a diversion that holds the attention

stems_affixes.word_buile: amuse娱乐+ment表名词→n.娱乐,消遣,乐趣
muse文艺音乐,娱乐等+um场所→n.博物馆,展览馆

stems_affixes.value_cn: 向……提供娱乐,使……消遣;引人发笑

sentences.en: To our amusement, the boy acted an old woman.
sentences.cn: 使我们感到好笑的是那男孩扮演了一个老太太。

means.word_mean: 娱乐活动, 文娱活动

sentences.en: They should not be treated only as amusements.
sentences.cn: 不能把它们单纯看成是娱乐活动。

jushi.english: Every kind of facility was laid on for their amusement.
jushi.chinese: 为供人们消遣特地安置了各种各样的设施。
大城市有许多娱乐活动。

jushi.english: To my amusement he couldn't get the door open.
jushi.chinese: 令我感到好笑的是他竟然打不开门。
